title: OpenDrawer Metadata Tier 6 - Derived Scores, Variab

The name of a derived variable or score.x-studyid: The stable, unique identifier for a study that never changes, even if other study metadata changes (like the study name, short name, owner, or project). Example: STUDY_SCA
The name of a derived variable or score.x-optional-persistent-row-identifier: Use studyID as the anchor, plus a persistent row identifier to identify a specific file/version, etc.
The name of a derived variable or score.x-optional-persistent-row-identifier-val: Enter a unique identifier for the selection made.
The name of a derived variable or score.x-optional-appliesto: Indicates the level of entity to which a metadata value applies (e.g., individual participant or population summary).
The name of a derived variable or score.x-optional-aggregationlevel: Specifies whether a metadata value represents individual-level data or an aggregate summary
The name of a derived variable or score.x-optional-populationscope: Identifies the population described by the metadata (e.g., study-wide, cohort, or study arm).
The name of a derived variable or score.x-derivedvariabletype: A controlled category describing the general method or type of derivation used to compute a derived variable or score (e.g., sum score, composite score, standardized score).
The name of a derived variable or score.x-variablesummary: Aggregate summary statistics describing the observed distribution and availability of a variable in a dataset, without exposing participant-level values.
The name of a derived variable or score.x-scorename: Is the human-readable name of a score derived from a measure, as used or labeled by the study.
The name of a derived variable or score.x-scoretype: Describes the general method or form by which a score was derived from a measure or assessment.
The name of a derived variable or score.x-derivedscore: A summary description of a score derived from a measure, including how it was calculated.
The name of a derived variable or score.x-derivationmethod: A high-level description of how a score was derived from raw or intermediate data.
The name of a derived variable or score.x-valuerange: The observed minimum and maximum values of a continuous variable within the reported population scope.
The name of a derived variable or score.x-totalparticipants: The total number of unique participants for whom data are available within the specified study, cohort, or scope.
The name of a derived variable or score.x-propotion: A numeric value representing the fraction of a population associated with a given category, typically expressed as a percentage or decimal.
The name of a derived variable or score.x-dataavailabilitysummary: An aggregate description of the amount and demographic composition of available data for a study, cohort, or variable, provided without individual-level records.
The name of a derived variable or score.x-valuerangeminvalue: The minimum observed value of a continuous variable within the specified population scope.
The name of a derived variable or score.x-valuerangemaxvalue: The maximum observed value of a continuous variable within the specified population scope.
The name of a derived variable or score.x-unit: The unit of measurement associated with a variable’s values or summary statistics (e.g., years, kg/m²).
The name of a derived variable or score.x-timepoint: A label identifying the study timepoint or phase at which the variable value or summary applies (e.g., baseline, follow-up).
